descriptions: L=2 Many-hypercube state preparation circuit. The five pairs of qubits are initialized to the logical |0 0⟩ L state of the [[4,2,2]] code (Equation ).

We investigated the impact and sensitivity of hardware noise further for the circuits in by employing noise scaling analysis to discover their pseudo-thresholding behavior (see Fig. ). We identified the error sources in Sqalesim most likely to have higher hardware drift and scaled them by a.

Arbitrary-length logical constant-depth CNOT ladder. A ⊕ on a measured data bit is flipped if the sum (modulo 2) of the measured ancilla bits above it with an ⊕ is 1. The qubits with/without a Hadamard a ied at the start are ancilla/data qubits, respectively.

We investigated the impact and sensitivity of hardware noise further for the circuits in by employing noise scaling analysis to discover their pseudo-thresholding behavior (see Fig. ). We identified the error sources in Sqalesim most likely to have higher hardware drift and scaled them by a.

Logical circuit for a 5 CNOT, constant-depth CNOT-ladder on a 4×2 grid of qubits. The brackets surround qubits on the same row. The dashed lines separate the circuit into three parts: the first creates a Bell pair between the ancilla row and the second data row, the second consists of the CNOTs from the first two sections of the original circuit (Figure ) being executed in parallel, and the third consists of the final CNOT from the original circuit, measurement, and classical correction.

We investigated the impact and sensitivity of hardware noise further for the circuits in by employing noise scaling analysis to discover their pseudo-thresholding behavior (see Fig. ). We identified the error sources in Sqalesim most likely to have higher hardware drift and scaled them by a.

Example of how redundant CX pairs appear and how to remove them. (a) will decompose a multi-qubit controlled operator into X gates (illustrated as CCX gates in the figure) and a single controlled-U gate. (b) can eliminate redundant control operations depending on the states of qubits. (c) Redundant CX pairs can be removed once they are identified as redundant.

Since all the qubits are initialized to \ket 0 state at the beginning of circuits, the labels are also initialized to \labelO. An obvious state change like \ket 0 to \ket 1 by Pauli X operator updates the label from \labelO~to \labelI. The X operator also flips the parity of \labelBell~qubits. If.

For our [3,1] code, we use the circuit in implement R 0 or R 1 depending on the outcome of the projection measurements \ P 0, P 1\ . As the implementation of R 0 and R 1 is probabilistic, we can calculate the probability of success p success as the sum of the probability of successfully.
A permutation gate in staircase form, consisting of 6 Toffoli gates.

Our first main result, which was presented in an earlier version of this paper~ , states that every permutation in \cC 3^\sym can be written in staircase form. We remark that there are permutations in staircase form which are not in \cC 3. To derive a full characterization, we consider bilinear.
Circuit diagram for the Gottesman–Mochon seven-qubit gate G (with time flowing from left to right).

Our first main result, which was presented in an earlier version of this paper~ , states that every permutation in \cC 3^\sym can be written in staircase form. We remark that there are permutations in staircase form which are not in \cC 3. To derive a full characterization, we consider bilinear.
This circuit for 1,2,4 1,3,4 1,2,3 is in staircase form but not mismatch-free, as qubit 3 is used as a control for 1,3,4 and a target for 1,2,3.
